meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a light metallic ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys jingling her keys when she walks.
meanings.sent2: The bells on the cat's collar were jingling as it ran around the house.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the chimes jingle in a merry tune.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter jingled like a string of tiny bells.
meanings.sent5: The coins in his pocket jingled softly as he moved.

meanings.sent1: The jingling of the wind chimes filled the garden with music.
meanings.sent2: The jingling of the sleigh bells signaled the arrival of Santa Claus.
meanings.sent3: The jingling of the bells made the horse dance happily.
meanings.sent4: The jingling of the tambourine added a festive touch to the music.
meanings.sent5: The jingling of the coins in the jar was a satisfying sound.

meanings.sent1: The jingling of the keys in her pocket was a familiar sound.
meanings.sent2: The jingling of the bracelets on her wrist was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The jingling of the dog's tags announced his arrival.
meanings.sent4: The jingling of the bells on the door signaled a visitor.
meanings.sent5: The jingling of the coins in the piggy bank was music to her ears.
